revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: "Epeiph 12. Delivered by Paianos, son of Valerios, for the third indiction on account of the villagers of Karanis, five and a half, a third and a twelfth artabas of pure wheat, 5 1/2 1/3 1/12 art. only, no other record or receipt being produced for the aforesaid artabas. (2nd hd.) Signed, Theodotos. (3rd hd.) Signed, Herodes. (4th hd.) 5 1/2 1/3 1/12 art. of which on account of the syndicate of Ouphr . . . . . 5 1/2 1/3 1/12 art.;(1st hd.) Epeiph 23. Delivered by Paianos, son of Valerios, for the third indiction on account of the villagers of Ptolemais, dependency of Karanis, two and a half, a third and a twelfth artabas of pure wheat, 2 1/2 1/3 1/12 art. only. (3rd hd.) Signed, Herodes. (2nd hd.) Signed Theodotos.;(1st hd.) And on the 25 th likewise by the same Paianos, son of Valerios, for the third indiction on account of the villagers of Karanis, three artabas of pure wheat, 3 art. only. (4th hd.) 3 art., of which (on account of the syndicate) of Ouphr. . . . . 3 art. (2nd hd.) Signed Theodotos.;(1st hd.) On the same day likewise by the same for the same indictionon account of the villagers of Ptolemais, dependency of Karanis, three artabas of pure wheat, 3 art. only. (2nd hd.) Signed, Theodotos. (5th hd.) Signed, Phi[ ]."

listBibl.bibl: Coles RA, TAPA 97, 61-6, 1966 -- SB X 10729 -- BL VII, 221 N. Lewis dates the piece to 330 AD; but, contrast PCol VII, pg. 65, which dates it to 345 AD Bagnall RS-Worp KA, CE 59, 310-311, 1984 -- SB XX 14380
